quizzes.title: Flutter Basics
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge of Flutter fundamentals

options: A UI framework for building cross-platform applications
questions.explanation: Flutter is a UI framework developed by Google for building natively compiled applications for mobile, web, and desktop from a single codebase.

questions.questionText: Which widget is used to create a scrollable list in Flutter?
questions.explanation: ListView is a scrollable list of widgets arranged linearly.

questions.questionText: What is the main purpose of setState() in Flutter?
options: To update the UI when data changes
questions.explanation: setState() is used to notify the framework that the internal state of a State object has changed, which triggers a rebuild of the widget.

quizzes.title: Dart Fundamentals
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge of Dart programming language

questions.questionText: What is the main difference between var and final in Dart?
options: var can be reassigned, final cannot
final can be reassigned, var cannot
var is for numbers, final is for strings
questions.explanation: var allows reassignment of values, while final creates an immutable reference that cannot be reassigned after initialization.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a valid way to declare a function in Dart?
questions.explanation: In Dart, functions are declared using the return type (or void) followed by the function name and parameters.

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of the async keyword in Dart?
options: To mark a function as asynchronous
questions.explanation: The async keyword is used to mark a function as asynchronous, allowing the use of await and handling of Future objects.
